transforms.code:
# Find the dashboard that corresponds with the default dash ID,
	# and return the name of this dashboard.
	
	dashboards = self.session.custom.dashboard.dashboards.dashboards
	
	for dashboard in dashboards:
		if dashboard.id == value:
			return dashboard.name
	
	return 'Error'

props.path: Building Automation Demo/Page/Systems Overview/Framework/Dashboard/Select Dashboard/Select Dashboard

transforms.code:
# Create a byte array from the 'profileimage' bytes, write the
	# bytes to a 'file', use imghdr.what to attempt to determine the image
	# file type, create the 'source' which contains the image bytes encoded
	# in base64, close the file, and then return the 'source' string.
	
	from com.inductiveautomation.ignition.common import Base64
	import array
	import StringIO
	import imghdr
	
	data = value
	if data != None:
		f = StringIO.StringIO()
		f.write(data)
		
		fileType = imghdr.what(f)
		source = "data:image/{};base64,{}".format(fileType,Base64.encodeBytes(data))
		f.close()
	else:
		source = None
		
	return source

props.path: Building Automation Demo/Page/User Config/Framework/Built In Icon

config.script:
# Set addPhoto to true, which will make the 'Add Photo' container visible.
	
	self.view.getChild("root").custom.addPhoto = True

import array
	import java.lang.Exception
	
	# Define themeMap which maps the underlying theme names with theme names
	# being saved in the db.
	themeMap = {'hvac':'lightCool','hvac-dark':'darkCool','hvac-warm':'lightWarm','hvac-dark-warm':'darkWarm'}
	
	# Retrieve the title for the user.
	title = self.parent.parent.getChild("Title Cont").getChild("Title").props.text
	
	# Retrieve the updated userConfig.
	userConfig = self.view.getChild("root").custom.userConfig
	
	# Define the params for the updateUser named query. If userConfig.image
	# is not equal to null, then convert the image to a byte array. If title
	# is still displaying 'Guest' (default title if this column is null in
	# the db), then supply null for the title param.
	params = ({'id':userConfig.id,'builtin':userConfig.builtIn,
	'imagestr':userConfig.imageStr,
	'profileimage':array.array('b',userConfig.image) if userConfig.image != None else None,
	'defaultdash':userConfig.defaultDash,'theme':themeMap[self.session.props.theme],
	'usebuiltin':userConfig.useBuiltIn,'title':title if title != 'Guest' else None})
	
	# Try to update the info in the db for this user. Then, refresh the binding
	# on the user custom session property (to retrieve the updated config), and
	# then notify user that the settings were saved. Utilize try-except so that
	# if the save fails, can show a notification informing the user that the
	# save failed (and also use logger to log the reason why the save failed).
	
	logger = system.util.getLogger('userConfig')
	try:
		system.db.runNamedQuery('User/updateUser',parameters=params)
		self.session.refreshBinding('custom.user')
		self.parent.parent.parent.getChild("Results Cont").getChild("Results").getChild("Label").props.text = 'Settings saved!'
	except Exception, e:
		logger.info(str(e.message) + ', ' + str(e.args))
		self.parent.parent.parent.getChild("Results Cont").getChild("Results").getChild("Label").props.text = 'Settings not saved'
	except java.lang.Exception, e:
		logger.info(str(e))
		self.parent.parent.parent.getChild("Results Cont").getChild("Results").getChild("Label").props.text = 'Settings not saved'
		
	# Utilize transform to rotate the 'notification' such that it becomes visible
	# to the user (letting user know if save was successful or not).
	self.parent.parent.parent.getChild("Results Cont").getChild("Results").props.style.transform = 'rotateX(0deg)'
	
	# Utilize Timer to re-hide the 'notification' after 3 seconds.
	from threading import Timer
	
	def hidePopup():
		"""
		Sets the transform style property of the Results container
			to 'rotateX(90deg)', which rotates the container by 90
			degrees on the x-axis. Visually, this causes the
			notification to 'swing' upwards out of view. 
				
		Args:
			This function does not contain any args.
				
		Returns:
			This function does not return a value.
		"""
		
		self.parent.parent.parent.getChild("Results Cont").getChild("Results").props.style.transform = 'rotateX(90deg)'
	
	Timer(3.0,hidePopup,[]).start()

if self.view.getChild("root").custom.userConfig.useBuiltIn == 0 and self.view.getChild("root").custom.userConfig.image == None:
		self.parent.parent.parent.getChild("Results Cont").getChild("Results").getChild("Label").props.text = 'Please select a built-in icon or upload an image.'
		
		# Utilize transform to rotate the 'notification' such that it becomes visible
		# to the user.
		self.parent.parent.parent.getChild("Results Cont").getChild("Results").props.style.transform = 'rotateX(0deg)'
		
		# Utilize Timer to re-hide the 'notification' after 3 seconds.
		from threading import Timer
		
		def hidePopup():
			"""
			Sets the transform style property of the Results container
				to 'rotateX(90deg)', which rotates the container by 90
				degrees on the x-axis. Visually, this causes the
				notification to 'swing' upwards out of view. 
				
			Args:
				This function does not contain any args.
					
			Returns:
				This function does not return a value.
			"""
			
			self.parent.parent.parent.getChild("Results Cont").getChild("Results").props.style.transform = 'rotateX(90deg)'
		
		Timer(3.0,hidePopup,[]).start()
	else:
		# Set addPhoto to false, which causes the Settings container to become visible.
		self.view.getChild("root").custom.addPhoto = False

# Change currTab to 'builtIn', which causes the list of built-in icons to
	# become visible. Also set useBuiltIn to true in user config (if user
	# presses 'builtIn' tab, assume that user wants to use a built-in icon
	# instead of uploading a profile image). 
	
	self.parent.parent.parent.getChild("Add Photo").custom.currTab = 'builtIn'
	self.view.getChild("root").custom.userConfig.useBuiltIn = 1

# Change currTab to 'fromComputer', which causes the file upload component
	# to become visible. Also set useBuiltIn to false in user config (if user
	# presses 'fromComputer' tab, assume that user wants to upload an image). 
	
	self.parent.parent.parent.getChild("Add Photo").custom.currTab = 'fromComputer'
	self.view.getChild("root").custom.userConfig.useBuiltIn = 0

transforms.code:
# Create the built-in icon instances, and utilize the built-in icon path
	# to make sure that the correct built-in icon is selected.
	
	builtInDB = value['builtIn'] if value['builtIn'] != None else 'Person'

	instances = []
	for option in self.custom.options:
		instanceStyle = option.instanceStyle
		instancePos = option.instancePosition
		name = option.name
		fill = option.fill
		
		if name == builtInDB:
			selected = True
		else:
			selected = False
	
		obj = {"instanceStyle": instanceStyle,"instancePosition": instancePos,"name": name,"fill": fill,"selected": selected}
	
		instances.append(obj)
	
	return instances

config.script:
# Get the bytes and file name of the image and update userConfig.image (bytes)
	# and userConfig.imageStr (file name).
	
	data = event.file.getBytes()
	self.view.getChild("root").custom.userConfig.image = data
	self.view.getChild("root").custom.userConfig.imageStr = event.file.name

props.path: Building Automation Demo/Page/User Config/Framework/Built In Icon

config.script:
# Clear out image bytes and image file name.
	
	self.view.getChild("root").custom.userConfig.image = None
	self.view.getChild("root").custom.userConfig.imageStr = None

messageHandlers.script:
# User has selected one of the four built-in icons.
	
	# Get the selected built-in icon name and the previous 
	# built-in icon name.
	builtIn = payload['builtIn']	
	prevBuiltIn = self.custom.userConfig.builtIn if self.custom.userConfig.builtIn != None else 'Person'
	
	# Find the icon that corresponds to the previous built-in 
	# icon name, and de-select it.
	for option in self.getChild("Add Photo").getChild("Built In Icons").props.instances:
		if option['name'] == prevBuiltIn:
			option['selected'] = False
			break
	
	# Find the icon that corresponds to the new built-in 
	# icon name, and select it.	
	for option in self.getChild("Add Photo").getChild("Built In Icons").props.instances:
		if option['name'] == builtIn:
			option['selected'] = True
			break
	
	# Update the built-in icon name in the userConfig 
	# custom property.		
	self.custom.userConfig.builtIn = builtIn

# User's default dashboard was changed. Update the defaultDash
	# custom property to the dashID from the payload.
	
	dashID = payload['id']
		
	self.custom.userConfig.defaultDash = dashID
